text.#text: As soon as practicable after the date of enactment of the Act, the Secretary shall file a map and a boundary description of each area designated as wilderness by this section with the

Lands within the exterior boundaries of any wilderness area designated under this section that are owned by the State of Colorado or by a private entity shall be included within such wilderness area if such lands are acquired by the United States. Such lands may be acquired by the United States only as provided in the
Subject to valid existing rights, lands designated as wilderness by this Act shall be managed by the Secretary in accordance with the

, and the guidelines set forth in appendix A of House Report 101–405 of the 101st Congress.

Nothing in this Act restricts or precludes—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including military overflights that can be seen or heard within any wilderness area;

text.#text: low-level overflights of military helicopters over the areas designated as wilderness by
military flight testing and evaluation; or
the designation or creation of new units of special use airspace, or the establishment of military flight training routes over any wilderness area.

The Colorado Army National Guard, through the High-Altitude Army National Guard Aviation Training Site, may conduct aerial navigation training maneuver exercises over the wilderness areas designated by this Act—

The Secretary may continue to authorize competitive running events currently permitted in the Redcloud Peak Wilderness Area and Handies Peak Wilderness Area in a manner compatible with the preservation of such areas as wilderness.

If the Secretary trades privately owned land within the perimeter of the Redcloud Peak Wilderness Area or the Handies Peak Wilderness Area in exchange for Federal land, then such Federal land shall be located in Hinsdale County, Colorado.

text.#text: Except for activities provided for under
Nothing in this Act—
affects the use or allocation, in existence on the date of enactment of this Act, of any water, water right, or interest in water;
affects any vested absolute or decreed conditional water right in existence on the date of enactment of this Act, including any water right held by the United States;
affects any interstate water compact in existence on the date of enactment of this Act;
authorizes or imposes any new reserved Federal water rights; and
shall be considered to be a relinquishment or reduction of any water rights reserved or appropriated by the United States in the State on or before the date of the enactment of this Act.
The purpose of this subsection is to protect for the benefit and enjoyment of present and future generations—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (including the geological, cultural, archaeological, paleontological, natural, scientific, recreational, environmental, biological, wilderness, wildlife, riparian, historical, educational, and scenic resources of the public land); and

text.#text: the unique and nationally important values of areas designated as wilderness by
the water resources of area streams, based on seasonally available flows, that are necessary to support aquatic, riparian, and terrestrial species and communities.
